data.enText: say sth is true
to say that sth is true although it has not been proved and other people may not believe it

data.chText: 他声称他未得到公正的申述机会。
data.enText: He claims (that) he was not given a fair hearing.
I don't claim to be an expert.

data.chText: 科学家们宣称攻克癌症已有重大的突破。
data.enText: Scientists are claiming a major breakthrough in the fight against cancer.

data.chText: 据说有些医生每周工作80小时。
data.enText: It was claimed that some doctors were working 80 hours a week.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: demand legal right
to demand or ask for sth because you believe it is your legal right to own or to have it
A lot of lost property is never claimed.
He claimed political asylum.
money
to ask for money from the government or a company because you have a right to it

data.chText: 他无权要求领取失业救济金。
data.enText: He's not entitled to claim unemployment benefit.

data.chText: 她因受伤向公司要求获得损害赔偿金。
data.enText: She claimed damages from the company for the injury she had suffered.

data.chText: 你本可以从你的保险中索取旅馆住房费。
data.enText: You could have claimed the cost of the hotel room from your insurance.

data.chText: 你可按你的保险索赔你遗忘在火车上的大衣。
data.enText: You can claim on your insurance for that coat you left on the train.
attention/thought
to get or take sb's attention

data.chText: 一件最讨厌的事情需要他去考虑。
data.enText: A most unwelcome event claimed his attention.
gain/win
to gain, win or achieve sth

data.chText: 她终于成了那支队的队员。
data.enText: She has finally claimed a place on the team.
cause death

before.enText: of a disaster, an accident, etc.

data.enText: to cause sb's death

data.chText: 那次撞车事故导致三人死亡。
data.enText: The car crash claimed three lives.
claim sth↔back
to ask or demand to have sth returned because you have a right to it

data.chText: 你可以要求退回购物时缴纳的税款。
data.enText: You can claim back the tax on your purchases.
saying sth is true
a statement that sth is true although it has not been proved and other people may not agree with or believe it

data.chText: 这名歌手已否认那家杂志有关她要离开乐队的说法。
data.enText: The singer has denied the magazine's claim that she is leaving the band.
legal right

data.chText: （尤指对财产、土地等要求拥有的）所有权
data.enText: a right that sb believes they have to sth, especially property, land, etc.

data.chText: 他们无权索要那块土地。
data.enText: They had no claim on the land.

data.chText: 她为这本书的成功立了头功。
data.enText: She has more claim to the book's success than anybody (= she deserves to be praised for it) .
for money

data.chText: （尤指向公司、政府等）索款，索赔
data.enText: a request for a sum of money that you believe you have a right to, especially from a company, the government, etc.
You can make a claim on your insurance policy.
to put in a claim for an allowance
a claim for £2 000

data.chText: 你的费用一定要在月底以前办理报销。
data.enText: Make sure your claims for expenses are submitted by the end of the month.
a three per cent pay claim
Complete a claim form (= an official document which you must use in order to request money from an organization) .
claim to fame

data.chText: 一举出名的事；成名的一件事
data.enText: one thing that makes a person or place important or interesting

data.chText: 他的出名主要是因为他曾经是首相的中学同学。
data.enText: His main claim to fame is that he went to school with the Prime Minister.
have a claim on sb
to have the right to demand time, attention, etc. from sb
lay claim to sth

data.chText: 声称对…的拥有权；提出对…的所有权
data.enText: to state that you have a right to own sth
make no claim
used when you are saying that you cannot do sth

data.chText: 我自认为不懂现代艺术。
data.enText: I make no claim to understand modern art.

data.chText: 以上各词均表示未经证实的说法。
data.enText: These are all words for a statement that sth is true, although it has not been proved.
claim
a statement that sth is true, although it has not been proved
allegation
( rather formal ) a public statement that is made without giving proof, accusing sb of doing sth that is wrong or illegal
assertion
( rather formal ) a statement of sth that you strongly believe to be true, although it has not been proved

data.chText: 如果对所谈问题存疑是因为看法不同，而非因与事实不符，用assertion：
data.enText: When the point in doubt is a matter of opinion, not fact, use assertion .
She made sweeping claims about the role of women in society.

data.chText: 如果所谈问题是事实，用任何一词均可。assertion比claim语气稍强，且更正式。
data.enText: When you are talking about a matter of fact you can use either word; an assertion may be slightly stronger than a claim and it is a more formal word.
claim or assertion?
contention

data.chText: 尤指争论中的看法、观点
data.enText: ( formal ) a belief or opinion that you express, especially in an argument
a(n) claim/allegation/assertion/contention that…
a(n) claim/allegation/assertion about/of sth
false/unfounded/conflicting claims/allegations/assertions/contentions
to make/challenge/withdraw a(n) claim/allegation/assertion/contention

means: (尤指对财产、土地等要求拥有的)所有权
(尤指向公司、政府等)索款，索赔

ex.chText: 该政府已宣布进入紧急状态。
ex.enText: The government has declared a state of emergency.

ex.chText: 美国政府于1941年对日本宣战。
ex.enText: The US administration declared war on Japan in 1941.

synonyms.bx: 指公开而郑重地宣布某事，通常用于正式场合。

ex.chText: 政府宣布在海底发现了另一个大油田。
ex.enText: The government announced the discovery of another large oilfield at the bottom of the sea.

ex.chText: 杰克和苏珊宣布他们下周六结婚。
ex.enText: Jack and Susan announced that they would get married the next Saturday.

synonyms.bx: 通常用于正式宣布消息、决定、计划等。

ex.chText: 他声称拥有这栋房子。
ex.enText: He claimed that he owned the house.

ex.chText: 她声称看见我哭了。
ex.enText: She claimed to have seen me crying.

ex.chText: 该组织声称对这一事件负责。
ex.enText: The group claimed responsibility for the event.

synonyms.bx: 指声称拥有某物、某事属实、对某事负责。

ex.chText: 总统宣布南苏丹独立。
ex.enText: The President proclaimed the independence of the Republic of South Sudan.

ex.chText: 年轻的公主后来被宣布为女王。
ex.enText: The young princess was later proclaimed queen.

synonyms.bx: 指官方宣布重大政治事件，如国家独立、国王等的即位。

ex.chText: 下个月将颁布新的交通法规。
ex.enText: New traffic rules will be published next month.

ex.chText: 最新的就业数据将于明早公布。
ex.enText: The latest employment figures will be published tomorrow morning.

synonyms.bx: 通常用被动语态，指通过报刊或其他媒介向公众公布信息。

ex.chText: 工人们要求9点50分到10点10分之间为休息时间。
ex.enText: The workers demanded a break between 9:50 and 10:10.

ex.chText: 他要求董事会给出一个明确答复。
ex.enText: He demanded a clear answer from the board.

ex.chText: 她要求知道谁负责这次行动。
ex.enText: She demanded to know who was in charge of this action.

synonyms.bx: 指强烈要求某事物，尤用于认为自己有权这么做时。

ex.chText: 你要求过分了！
ex.enText: You are asking too much!

ex.chText: 他太忙了，不得不请求帮助。
ex.enText: He was so busy that he had to ask for help.

ex.chText: 主席要求给出解释。
ex.enText: The chairman asked for an explanation.

synonyms.bx: 指要求某人提供帮助、建议、信息等。

ex.chText: 那些申请政治避难者大多数都是难民。
ex.enText: Most of those who claimed asylum were refugees.

ex.chText: 银行要求苏珊付款。
ex.enText: The bank claimed payment from Susan.

ex.chText: 他们就这次损失向那家快递公司提出赔偿要求。
ex.enText: They claimed losses from the express company.

synonyms.bx: 指因有权得到某事物而公开提出要求。

ex.chText: 军官要求警察都穿警服。
ex.enText: The officer expected the policemen to wear police uniforms.

ex.chText: 这对年轻的夫妇对他们的孩子期望很高。
ex.enText: This young couple expects a lot of their child.

synonyms.bx: 指出于责任或常理而要求某人做某事，含期待之意。

data.enText: claim to fame

data.chText: 一举出名的事；成名的一件事
data.enText: one thing that makes a person or place important or interesting

data.chText: 他的出名主要是因为他曾经是首相的中学同学。
data.enText: His main claim to fame is that he went to school with the Prime Minister.
have a claim on sb
to have the right to demand time, attention, etc. from sb
lay claim to sth

data.chText: 声称对…的拥有权；提出对…的所有权
data.enText: to state that you have a right to own sth
make no claim
used when you are saying that you cannot do sth

data.chText: 我自认为不懂现代艺术。
data.enText: I make no claim to understand modern art.
stake (out) a/your claim (to/for/on sth)

data.chText: 公开宣布自己（对某物）的所有权；向公众表示某物应属于自己
data.enText: to say or show publicly that you think sth should be yours

data.chText: 亚当斯昨天轻松获胜，这无异于告诉人们奥运代表队中应有他的位置。
data.enText: Adams staked his claim for a place in the Olympic team with his easy win yesterday.
claim sth↔back
to ask or demand to have sth returned because you have a right to it

data.chText: 你可以要求退回购物时缴纳的税款。
data.enText: You can claim back the tax on your purchases.

tr: demand for something as rightful or due
example: they struck in support of their claim for a shorter work day
a strong legal claim to the property
he had no documents confirming his title to his father's estate

tr: an assertion of a right (as to money or property)
an assertion that something is true or factual
example: his claim that he was innocent

tr: a demand especially in the phrase "the call of duty"
take as an undesirable consequence of some event or state of affairs
example: The hard work took its toll on her

tr: state to be true or existing
example: He claimed that he killed the burglar
She took credit for the whole idea

tr: ask for legally or make a legal claim to, as of debts, for example
example: They claimed on the maximum allowable amount

tr: demand as being one's due or property
assert one's right or title to
example: He claimed his suitcases at the airline counter
Mr. Smith claims special tax exemptions because he is a foreign resident

value.def: If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

example.ex: He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him...
example.tran: 他声称这一切都是一场针对他的阴谋。

example.ex: A man claiming to be a journalist threatened to reveal details about her private life...
example.tran: 一个自称是记者的人威胁要公开有关她的私生活的细节。

example.ex: 'I had never received one single complaint against me,' claimed the humiliated doctor...
example.tran: “从来没有人投诉过我，”感到受辱的那名医生宣称。

example.ex: He claims a 70 to 80 per cent success rate.
example.tran: 他声称成功率有七到八成。

value.def: A claim is something which someone says which they cannot prove and which may be false.

example.ex: He repeated his claim that the people of Trinidad and Tobago backed his action...
example.tran: 他再次声称，特立尼达和多巴哥的人民支持他的行动。

example.ex: He rejected claims that he had affairs with six women.
example.tran: 他拒不承认他和6个女人有染的说法。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N that

value.def: If you say that someone claims responsibility or credit for something, you mean they say that they are responsible for it, but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

example.ex: An underground organisation has claimed responsibility for the bomb explosion...
example.tran: 一个地下组织已经声称对这起炸弹爆炸事件负责。

example.ex: He was too modest to claim the credit.
example.tran: 他太谦逊，不愿意邀功。

value.tran: 声称(负有责任或享有功劳)

value.def: If you claim something, you try to get it because you think you have a right to it.

example.ex: Now they are returning to claim what was theirs.
example.tran: 如今他们回来索取本属于他们的东西。

value.tran: 索取，索要(有权拥有的东西)

value.def: A claim is a demand for something that you think you have a right to.

example.ex: Rival claims to Macedonian territory caused conflict in the Balkans.
example.tran: 多方主张拥有对马其顿的领土主权，结果在巴尔干地区引发了冲突。

value.def: If someone claims a record, title, or prize, they gain or win it.

example.ex: Zhuang claimed the record in 54.64 seconds...
example.tran: 庄创下了54.64秒的纪录。

example.ex: Steffi Graf claimed a fourth Wimbledon title in 1992.
example.tran: 施特菲·格拉芙于1992年第4次赢得温布尔登桂冠。

value.tran: 取得，获得，赢得(纪录、冠军或奖励)

value.def: If you have a claim on someone or their attention, you have the right to demand things from them or to demand their attention.

example.ex: She'd no claims on him now...
example.tran: 现在他不欠她什么了。

example.ex: He was surrounded by people, all with claims on his attention.
example.tran: 他被人们团团围住，个个都要他把注意力放在自己身上。

value.def: If something or someone claims your attention, they need you to spend your time and effort on them.

example.ex: There is already a long list of people claiming her attention.
example.tran: 需要她关注的人已经很多了。

value.tran: 需要，要求(花时间或精力)

value.def: If you claim money from the government, an insurance company, or another organization, you officially apply to them for it, because you think you are entitled to it according to their rules.

example.ex: Some 25 per cent of the people who are entitled to claim State benefits do not do so...
example.tran: 有权申领政府补贴的人当中，约有25%没有提出申请。

example.ex: John had taken out redundancy insurance but when he tried to claim, he was refused payment...
example.tran: 约翰办理过失业保险，可是当他去索赔时却遭拒付。

example.ex: They intend to claim for damages against the three doctors.
example.tran: 他们打算向那3位医生索要损害赔偿。

example.ex: ...the office which has been dealing with their claim for benefit...
example.tran: 受理他们申领补助的办事处

example.ex: Last time we made a claim on our insurance they paid up really quickly.
example.tran: 上次我们申领保险赔付的时候，他们给付得非常爽快。

value.def: If you claim money or other benefits from your employers, you demand them because you think you deserve or need them.

example.ex: The union claimed a pay rise worth four times the rate of inflation.
example.tran: 工会要求按照通货膨胀率的4倍提高工资。

example.ex: They are making substantial claims for improved working conditions...
example.tran: 他们强烈要求改善工作环境。

example.ex: Electricity workers have voted for industrial action in pursuit of a pay claim.
example.tran: 电工们已经投票决定采取劳工行动以增加工资。

value.tran: (向雇主)索要，索取，讨要(钱、福利)

value.def: If you say that a war, disease, or accident claims someone's life, you mean that they are killed in it or by it.

example.ex: The civil war claimed the life of a U.N. interpreter yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天，内战夺去了一位联合国译员的生命。

example.ex: Heart disease is the biggest killer, claiming 180,000 lives a year.
example.tran: 心脏病是头号杀手，每年夺去18万条生命。

value.tran: (战争、疾病、事故)夺去(生命)，导致(死亡)

value.def: Someone's claim to fame is something quite important or interesting that they have done or that is connected with them.

example.ex: Barbara Follett's greatest claim to fame is that she taught Labour MPs how to look good on television.
example.tran: 芭芭拉·福利特最出名的事就是她教工党议员如何在电视上拥有良好形象。

value.def: If you lay claim to something you do not have, you say that it belongs to you.

example.ex: Five Asian countries lay claim to the islands.
example.tran: 5个亚洲国家声称对那些岛屿拥有主权。

trans: 无根据的请求权，无理要求；虚假陈述请求；虚假的索赔
独立请求书；独立权利要求
期待性请求权，不确定请求权
行李认领；领取行李；取行李处
剩余索偿权；剩余索取权；剩余权；取权；剩余请求权
提出索赔；索赔；保险索赔；理赔；一方提出索赔
赔偿请求；赔偿申请；赔偿要求；损坏索赔

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to cry out, to shout 呼喊, 叫喊
rootsaffixes.title: claim, clam

partsOfSpeech.dec: ac 加强 + claim 呼喊，叫喊 → 一再喊 → 欢呼
acclaim的名词，注意：名词中间没有i
clam 呼喊，叫喊 + or 表情况 → 喧哗，吵闹
clamor 喧哗，吵闹 + ous 多…的 → 吵闹的
de 加强 + claim 呼喊，叫喊 → 强调说 → 慷慨陈词
declaim的名词，注意：名词中间没有i
ex 出 + claim 呼喊，叫喊 → 叫喊；大声说出
pro 在前 + claim 呼喊，叫喊 → 在前面喊 → 公布
re 回 + claim 呼喊，叫喊 → 收回；开垦（荒地）
